Dear SARA GILBERT:
Attached is the Original Licensing Study Report for the above referenced facility. The
study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing statutes and
administrative rules. Therefore, an original license is issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHevuel, at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The agency is located on the 5th floor of a 6-story building in Muskegon,
Michigan. Upon exiting the elevator there are large bathrooms to the immediate
right. Down a hallway to the right is a large space shared by other tenants on the
floor that includes tables, chairs and has ample seating space. The agency rents
an office that is approximately 10 x 11 totaling 110 square feet. The office has 2
large storage cabinets with shelves, one is locked, and the other is not. All
confidential documents related to staff and clients will be kept in the locked
storage cabinet. To the immediate left of the agency office is a shared break room
that also leads to a large conference room. There is a printer in the shared space,
but it requires a code in order to print. The office has sufficient office space,
equipment, and supplies to ensure delivery of services.
B. Program Description
Rooted in Community (RIC) is a non-profit organization amplifying voices of youth,
families, and adults who have experienced harm. Focus will be on empowering
participants to make informed choices and navigating their own path toward well-
being, with support that respects their autonomy and personal journey. The
2

agency sees to serve and support the needs of Michigan families and children
without regard to age, gender(s), identity, marital status, national origin,
citizenship status, disability, genetic information, veteran status, lifestyle, cultural
or ethnic background, religious beliefs or absence of, and social or economic
status.
The agency will provide foster care and licensing services. The agency will
provide referrals for mental health and wellness, employment search assistance,
treatment plan development, at least weekly family time supervision,
transportation support, financial planning, and parenting supports and education.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The agency is in compliance with all rules and statutes at this time.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on substantial compliance with the rules, it is recommended that a six-month
original license be issued.
